p: Despite the potential to optimize the technique, practical steps to actualize applicability remain scarce. First, the developed nations have reference laboratories and/or satellite sample collection centers in strategic sites linked to the reference laboratory with well-equipped personnel skill wise and resources where the public can readily access guidance for rapid response ( Zammarchi et al., 2015a, Mcfarlane et al., 2014, Hegde et al., 2015). Such threshold of preparedness is widely lacking in Africa ( Laperriere et al., 2011, Kirya et al., 1977). The threshold of evidence on host immune status, sero-epidemiological genetic and ecological drivers of Zika-associated epidemics as well as knowledge of their vectors' regional distribution and evolving trends remains patchy and scarce ( Tambo and Xiao-Nong, 2014, Laperriere et al., 2011, Wauquier et al., 2010).
